args: Hey, Pietro. What's with the sighing?\nIs everything all right?
That's hard to believe, considering how\nupbeat he always is. Do you know if\nsomething happened, Cleo?
All I know is that he was reading this book\nhe found in our library.
Hm? ＂Troy to the World! Memoirs of my\nTimes as the World's Greatest Adventurer.＂\nSounds riveting.

Troy is a legendary adventurer of yore.
His stories were absurd to the extreme,
and he was known far and wide as a
supreme spinner of tall tales.
However, he was also greatly beloved,\nand his works were left behind to future\ngenerations in the form of faerie tales.
His adventures were also the basis for\nstories of the frozen city.
Huh. But you'd think that would make\nPietro happy.
I gave the book a quick read of my own.\nAt one point, Troy writes the following:
＂The legend of the frozen city is greatly\nexaggerated. False, even.＂
Poor guy. I wish I could cheer him up.
That may be difficult for a while.
Hmm? Oh, aren't you the girl we ran into\nwhen Pietro and I were testing his skis?
Yes. You really helped me out that day.
Actually, that's why I'm here. I heard Pietro\nwas feeling very down about something.
I wanted to thank him for what he did,\nso I made him some warm clothes.
Do you know where I can find him?
Aren't you the kids Pietro was telling his\nstories to?
Uh-huh! But we wanted to tell him about\nOUR adventures this time!
Yeeeah! We had an awesome adventure\non the hill behind the village, and we're\ngonna tell Pietro all about it!
It's gonna totally cheer him up.
Wait, so you all know about—
'Scuse me, but I heard Pietro's stayin'\nin this here castle. That right?
Hey! You're the lady who tricked Pietro!
You TRICKED him?! You're a bad lady!\nGo away, bad lady!
Oy, it ain't like that no more! Changed\nmy ways so I did, and been livin' on the\nstraight'n narrow ever since.
Pietro's passion sorta moved me, like, and\nI wanna help him out now that he's low.\nThought maybe I could give 'im this!
Just a big sack full'a glass and crystal\nshards. Been collectin' em for a while\nnow, yeah?
It's the same stuff what I used to trick 'im\nearlier, but I thought there might be some\nreal Nevermelt Ice mixed in there.
I see. And you're thinking if he could\nfind the real thing—
Then it might cheer 'im up! Cor, but\nyou're a clever one, ain't ya?
Well, I'm sorry to tell you this, but Pietro's\nshut himself up in his room.
Well then, we'll just have to find some\nreal Nevermelt Ice in this woman's\ngiant sack of junk!
But how will we know if we find it?\nAll this stuff looks the same...
We'll just have to search with our bare\nhands then, won't we?
If we find something that stays cold no\nmatter how long we hold it...
It's okay! We still have lots of them left\nto check.
You can stop this now. I know the\nfrozen city doesn't actually exist.
Which means it's utterly pointless to\nsearch for Nevermelt Ice.
How can you say that, Pietro?!
Now I'm just gutted, I am...
Fine, then! We'll just go and find the\nfrozen city ourselves!
I believe it's real, even if you don't—\nand I'm gonna find it!
I also believe in the frozen city!
Same here! Even if there ain't no\nNevermelt Ice in this here sack,\nI know I'll find some one day!
I... I don't know what to say.

Well, Pietro? What will you do?
Have faith in all of the people here,
or stop believing just because one
guy named Troy says it's not true?
Look, this Troy fellow may have been\nlying about visiting the frozen city.
But that doesn't mean that it's ACTUALLY\na myth, right?
And heck, if I can find the frozen city,\nI'll have done something that even\nTROY wasn't able to do!
I've never been so excited in all my life!\nTHIS is true adventure!
Blimey, but that's a fine attitude, so it is!
Thank you all for believing in me.
I'm gonna find the frozen city for sure.\nMy true adventure starts right now!
I'm so glad you're back to your old self,\nPietro. Er, but hold on one second...
I've been holding this crystal for a while\nnow, and it hasn't...warmed...up...at all.
